userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation: [Identification of item], Stuart Sanders Correspondence, WLU Coll. 0241, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA. In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections staff to verify the appropriate format.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Blue sheet prepared by Betty Kondayan (4/20/99)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sanders is a Class of 1931 alumnus of Washington and Lee University and was a businessman in Richmond from 1931-1934.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Sanders' correspondence to his parents regarding life at Washington and Lee University, including his participation in the Arcades Club fraternity (now Delta Upsilon), sports, classes, jobs, and the Lexington Presbyterian Church as well as comments on campus drinking and mention of his brother Irwin Sanders and friend Richard Gooch. Includes his correspondence during his job with his uncle, Stuart Sanders, in Richmond at Sanders Brothers from 1931-1934 with significant comments about the Depression years. Includes 16 photographs of family and friends.

controlaccess.subject: College Students -- Alcohol use
Depressions
Fraternal organizations

College Students -- Social conditions
College Students
controlaccess.corpname: Washington and Lee University. Delta Upsilon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of report cards, cards that certify class promotions from City Graded Schools, an excerpt from the Washington and Lee University Bulletin, and sketches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters and postcards mostly from Stuart Sanders to his parents. Stuart stayed with his Aunt for the summer, most likely somewhere near New York.

controlaccess.subject: United States Senate Chamber (United States Capitol, Washington, D.C.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters written from Stuart Sanders to his parents while he was at summer school at The McCallie School in Chattanooga, Tennessee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains mostly letters written by Robert Sanders concerning his son Stuart's college applications. He wrote to the presidents at the University of Florida and at Washington and Lee University, where Stuart's broter was a student. Washington and Lee granted Stuart a tentative place on their list of students, requiring he complete more credits in summer school. Upon completion of summer school at The McCallie School, Stuart was admitted officially to Washington and Lee.

did.unittitle: Correspondence During First Term at Washington and Lee

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Young Men's Christian Associations of North America

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes to his parents with news of football, his studies, and his desire for a typewriter. His report card is also included.

controlaccess.subject: Correspondence
controlaccess.corpname: Washington and Lee University. Arcades Fraternity

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from Stuart to his parents about his second term at Washington and Lee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file mostly contains letters from Stuart home to his parents during his last months of his first year at Washington and Lee. It also includes correspondence between Dr. Smith and Robert Sanders about Stuart's poor math grades.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes about his final exams and grades, plans for the summer, and courses for his second year at Washington and Lee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes home from his aunt's house in Canandaigua, NY, where he is for the summer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes about his brother, a new suit, school, sports, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters from Stuart to his parents and newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of correspondence between Stuart and his parents. It also consists of commencement material, where Irwin was the valedictorian. Stuart's letter to the president of the school applying for reinstatment (because of lack of credits) and the dean's response are included. Stuart was reinstated on strict probation.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Washington and Lee University. Arcades Fraternity

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of student publications mentioning Stuart and a photograph of Stuart in his track uniform. In the Ring Tum Phi there is an announcement of his election to head cheer leader. There are also campaign cards in the file. Newspapers from Sweetwater, TN and Memphis, TN wrote articles about Robert S. Sanders. And there are Arcades Club and Randolph Macon Woman's College bulletins.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence during the beginning of Stuart's junior year at Washington and Lee. Stuart is living in the fraternity house at this time.

controlaccess.corpname: Washington and Lee University. Arcades Fraternity
Washington and Lee University. Delta Upsilon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of correspondence from Stuart to his parents, as well as a few letters from Betty to Stuart's parents. Campaign cards from Stuart's campaign for head cheerleader are included.

controlaccess.subject: Cheerleading
controlaccess.corpname: Washington and Lee University. Delta Upsilon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from summer 1930 before Stuart's senior year at Washington and Lee.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Washington and Lee University. Arcades Fraternity

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of two issues of the Ring Tum Phi, both mentioning the study body elections. Stuart ran for the position of head cheerleader. A 1931 Washington and Lee Alumni Magazine is included. There is also the Arcades Club publication, 'The Arcadian,' where Stuart and Irwin's pictures are featured. And Irwin's 'Bulgaria and the Holy Land' is in the file.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters written by Stuart at the beginning of his senior year. He writes of his rocky relationship during this time with Betty. A program from the University Kentucky vs. Washington and Lee football game is also included.

controlaccess.corpname: Washington and Lee University. Delta Upsilon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of correspondence during he end of Stuart's senior year at Washington and Lee. It also consists of a baccalaureate program, a commencement program, a Finals Week Dances book and program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of correspondence from Staurt to his parents and family. At this time he was living in Richmond and working for his uncle at Sanders Brothers Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes to his parents with news of work and church in Richmond. He also writes of Irwin's trip back to America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes about Irwin and his Uncle Stuarts health. Irwin is at Princeton at this time. He also writes to his Unlce Tom and Aunt Kathleen thanking them for the car they gave him and of his Christmas plans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes to his family about church, work, and his social life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes letters to his parents, brother, and Dick about his social life, his relationship with Isabelle, and church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes to John M., his parents, Irwin, and Isabelle with news mostly of his church in Richmond and of his health. There are also a couple of letters from Isabelle to Stuart.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes about work, church, and his dating life. He also writes about the passing of his cousin Lorraine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stuart writes to his parents, Betty, Dick, Irwin, and other family members about his life in Richmond. During these months Irwin got married.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of mostly newspaper clippings relating to Grace Covenant Presbyterian Church, Richmond, Va. There are also many clippings of young women who hosted teas. There are papers and questions about an article, 'What is an Education.'

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Scribbler is a newspaper tha was published weekly by the Young People's Forum of Grace Covenant Presbyterian Church, Richmond, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of phtographs from various years. There are xeroxed photographs from A Picture History of the Sanders Family, lent to Special Collections in 2000 by Irwin Taylor Sanders II, professor of history at Washington and Lee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Items include:
Receipt from Office Equipment Co., Louisville, Ky., 1945
Washington and Lee Alumni Association of Richmond Washington-Cincinnati Day Banquet Program. Stuart was the president of the association at this time.
Reconversion of Industry, April 1946
A letter from Stuart
A commencement program from Centre College of Kentucky, 1965, when Irwin T. Sanders II was a graduate.
